ComicInfo.Characters: Buckaroo Betty [Elisabeth Fury],FemForce [Ms. Victory [Joan Wayne],Krone,Nightveil [Laura Wright],She-Cat [Jessica Hunt],Synn [Silva Synn],Tara [Tara Fremont]],Verden Fell
ComicInfo.Notes: Tagged with comicbox 1.2.0 on 2024-11-30T20:44:43 [Issue ID 4000-97221] urn:comicvine:4000-97221
ComicInfo.Summary: Special Spanish translation issue When She-Cat meets aging horror film great Verdon Fell, she is starstruck like we've never seen her. When the pushy 'Cat insists on horning in on the special midnite V.I.P. opening of his new Florida tourist attraction, she can't know trouble will follow. Fell's classic horror acting career fizzled when modern gory horror flooded the market, and when the three young directors he most blames for the change in film style take the tour with him, he has a murderous revenge scheduled for them, a' la Edgar Allen Poe. When the rest of the FF investigate some strange phenomena during a late-night storm, they discover the uncanny Enigma Cloud (Last seen in the Bolt series.) in Earth's atmosphere. Discerning that it's unpredictable vibrations were the cause of Fell's uncharacteristic homicidal streak, they arrive in time to save the directors and She-Cat from the unkindest cut of all. "The Cat And The Pendulum" is written by Bill Black, drawn by Brad Gorby, and inked by Mark Heike. It guest stars Buckaroo Betty, Krone, Burson and Barbara Fouche, Eddie Romeo ,Dario Demento, and Jack Contractor. It also features a Spanish-language synopsis of the story action on the bottom of each page.Color cover by Brad Gorby and Mark Heike, interiors are black and white with graytones. Standard comic book format.
ComicInfo.Title: The Cat and the Pendulum!
